questions.title: Design a Marketing Campaign System (HLD)
questions.prompt: Design a marketing campaign system for a platform like Salesforce. Users should be able to create campaigns, define target audiences based on criteria, schedule deliveries (email/push), and track engagement metrics.
followups: How do you handle audience segmentation for millions of users?
What database schema do you use for campaign definitions?
How do you schedule campaigns across different time zones?
Deep dive: How do you ensure exactly-once delivery of messages?
How do you handle failures in the middle of a large campaign?
What is the saga pattern and how would you apply it here?
How do you design a self-healing system for failed deliveries?

questions.title: Distributed Transactions & Saga Pattern
questions.prompt: We have a microservices architecture for an order processing system (Inventory, Payment, Shipping). A single order spans multiple services. Design a reliable transaction mechanism that maintains consistency without using a distributed 2PC coordinator.
followups: Explain the difference between choreography and orchestration sagas.
How do you implement compensating transactions?
What do you store in your transaction log?
How do you handle idempotency for retried operations?
What happens if the compensation itself fails?

questions.title: Design a Real-Time Collaborative Tool
questions.prompt: Design a real-time collaborative document editing feature (similar to Google Docs or Salesforce Quip). Focus on conflict resolution and concurrency control.
followups: Compare Operational Transformation (OT) vs CRDTs.
How do you handle offline edits and sync?
How do you scale WebSocket connections to millions of concurrent users?
What is the role of a central server vs peer-to-peer?

questions.title: Design a Scalable Notification Service
questions.prompt: Design a notification system that can send millions of emails, push notifications, and SMS messages per day. Requirements: user preferences, rate limiting, retries with exponential backoff, and provider failover.
followups: How do you prevent spamming users?
How do you handle provider outages?
How do you ensure idempotency to prevent duplicate messages?
What is the trade-off between at-least-once and exactly-once delivery?

questions.title: Implement a Custom Task Scheduler
questions.prompt: Design a job scheduler that supports: (1) Scheduling one-time and recurring tasks, (2) Priority queues, (3) Retries with backoff, (4) Worker scaling, (5) Monitoring for stuck jobs.
followups: What data structure do you use for the priority queue?
How do you ensure at-least-once execution?
How do you avoid duplicate work on retries?
How do you handle a worker crashing mid-task?

questions.title: Performance Optimization: P99 Latency
questions.prompt: Your service meets average latency targets but consistently fails at the 99th percentile (P99). Describe your end-to-end strategy to diagnose and mitigate tail latency.
followups: What are common causes of tail latency in distributed systems?
How do you instrument your code to capture P99 effectively?
What is head-of-line blocking and how do you fix it?
How do you implement client-side timeouts and retries?

questions.title: JVM Deep Dive: Memory Leak Analysis
questions.prompt: Your Java application has been running fine for weeks, but recently it started throwing OutOfMemoryError after 2-3 hours of load. Walk me through your exact diagnosis and remediation strategy.
followups: What commands do you run immediately (jstat, jstack, jmap)?
How do you capture a heap dump and analyze it with Eclipse MAT?
What is a classloader leak and how do you fix it?
How do you set up proactive monitoring to catch this before it crashes?

questions.title: Multi-Threaded Rate Limiter
questions.prompt: Implement a thread-safe rate limiter that supports `tryAcquire()` for a given user ID. The rate limiter should allow N requests per minute. Optimize for minimal contention under high concurrency.
followups: What lock granularity do you use?
How does a sliding window log differ from a token bucket?
How would you implement this in a distributed environment?
What is the ABA problem in the context of CAS?

questions.title: Design a Global Distributed Cache
questions.prompt: Design a distributed cache that spans multiple data centers globally. It must provide low-latency reads and handle write conflicts.
followups: What consistency model do you target (strong vs eventual)?
How do you handle cache invalidation across regions?
What is a cache stampede and how do you prevent it?
How do you handle network partitions?

questions.title: Implement a Lock-Free Concurrent Data Structure
questions.prompt: Implement a lock-free stack or queue using Compare-And-Swap (CAS) primitives. Explain how you handle the ABA problem.
followups: How do hazard pointers or epoch-based reclamation work?
What are the performance trade-offs between lock-free and locking?
How do you test a lock-free data structure for correctness?

questions.title: Design Salesforce's Multi-Tenant Architecture
questions.prompt: Explain how Salesforce achieves data isolation and scalability in its multi-tenant architecture. How are metadata and data stored?
followups: What is the difference between row-level and table-level multi-tenancy?
How does Salesforce handle governor limits per tenant?
How do you migrate a tenant from one shared instance to a dedicated instance?

questions.title: Behavioral: Technical Grilling by Hiring Manager
questions.prompt: The HM grilled you on your current project architecture for 45 minutes. Walk me through your thought process as you defended your design decisions.
followups: What was the most controversial design decision you made?
How did you convince senior stakeholders that your approach was correct?
If you had to re-implement it today, what would you do differently?
How do you mentor junior engineers on the team?

questions.title: Behavioral: Leadership and Mentoring
questions.prompt: Tell me about your roles and responsibilities in your current team. How do you exhibit leadership without formal authority?
followups: Describe a time you mentored a junior developer. How did you adapt your style?
How do you handle a situation where a teammate is underperforming?
What is your philosophy on code reviews?

questions.title: Salesforce Product Knowledge
questions.prompt: What is a new Salesforce product or feature that you have learned about recently? Why is it significant?
followups: How does this product solve a customer pain point?
What are the technical challenges in implementing this feature?
How does it compete with other products in the market?
